definitions.definition: to completely fill your mind so that you cannot think of anything else, in a way that is not reasonable or normal
definitions.sensetop: be obsessed by somebody/somethingbe obsessed with somebody/somethingobsess somebody

examples.text: The need to produce the most exciting newspaper story obsesses most journalists.

definitions.definition: to be always talking or worrying about a particular thing, especially when this annoys other people

examples.text: I think you should try to stop obsessing about food.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘haunt, possess’, referring to an evil spirit): from Latin obsess- ‘besieged’, from the verb obsidere, from ob- ‘opposite’ + sedere ‘sit’. The current sense dates from the late 19th cent.
